agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers self-help for recovery without relapse to those addicted to drugs and alcohol.

agency_desc: A state government agency that develops, finances, and administers the Child Care and Development Fund (CCDF) programming in the State of Indiana.

site_details: Visit the website https://earlyedconnect.fssa.in.gov/onlineApp/home to complete and submit an electronic application. This application will put you on a waitlist. Applicant may also complete the online email form to request assistance.

site_eligibility: Children must be 4 years old by August 1st of the pre-K year -- Household income at or below 127% of Federal Poverty Level -- Parents/guardians in the household must be working, going to school, attending job training, or looking for a job -- Depending on funding, households at 185% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible if a parent or guardian living in the household is working, going to school, attending job training, or looking for a job -OR- a parent/guardian receives Social Security Disability Insurance or Supplemental Security Income (also known as SSDI or SSI) benefits

Receives pasteurized donor milk from The Milk Bank and distributes it to approved recipients to meet a variety of needs. Short-term use is ideal at discharge, when transitioning to work, during a brief illness or absence, or as a bridge to finding a new formula. Long-term use is ideal for infants with ongoing medical needs.

Donor Milk Express (DMX) sites may only be used by approved recipients; see Service Details section below to learn more about the approval process.

agency_desc: A christian-based, nonprofit organization that provides a group home and daily support to single, pregnant women who choose life for themselves and their babies.
service_description: Provides a christian-based residential group home for women who are experiencing a crisis pregnancy. The women may stay at the group home during their pregnancy and after the birth for a maximum of 18 months. Clients participate in weekly life-skills and receive physical and emotional support as they prepare to either parent their baby or go through the adoption process.
site_details: Call the intake line for availability and information; leave a voicemail with contact information, (include date of call), or try calling again later to reach a staff person.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women -- 18 or older -- without children or with up to 2 preschool-aged children -- Without substance abuse issues -- Not currently fleeing a serious domestic violence situation -- General Sobriety

agency_desc: The Indiana chapter of a national nonprofit organization whose mission is "to stop drunk driving, to support the victims of this violent crime and to help prevent underage drinking."

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit website for information or to order materials; calls are returned within 48 hours.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- State Office (voicemail): Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- State Office (voicemail): Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a method for local law enforcement to receive information on crimes.

Accepts information on any felony crime or fugitive without asking for the name of the caller, and forwards the information to the appropriate law enforcement agency for investigation. Rewards are based on various factors of the crime.

Visit www.marionhealth.org/programs/population-health/maternal-and-child-health/babe-program or

Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

agency_desc: The Indiana office of the United States federal tax collection agency.
service_description: Provides a website with options for filing federal income taxes online (e-filing). Clients click on the individual taxpayer link to go to a page with information about how to choose a product to file their taxes electronically for free. In order to use the Free File software, the taxpayer must be under the annual Adjusted Gross Income limit. Filers over the limit can use the forms located on the website to e-file their taxes or they can purchase a commercial software product.
site_details: Visit the website, www.irs.gov/filing/free-file-do-your-federal-taxes-for-free, for information.
site_schedule: Call Center: Mon-Fir 7am-7pm -- Website: Daily 24 hours
Call Center: Mon-Fir 7am-7pm -- Website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: With 2021 Adjusted Gross Income (AGI) of $73,000 or less -- With a valid email address

site_details: Order by Mail: Download and print Form 49607 (births) or Form 49606 (deaths) from website or call to have form mailed. Mail completed form along with payment and copies of required documentation. -- Order Online: Go to www.vitalrecords.in.gov and click "Order Now" -- Complete required fields. If no driver's license or state-issued ID number is provided, required identification documents must be scanned and uploaded to the site. -- Check Order Status: Go to www.vitalrecords.in.gov and click "Check Status". Enter required information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:15am-4:30pm -- Online and Phone Ordering: Daily 24 hours

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Provides online application and renewal for handgun licenses in Indiana. At the end of the online form, applicants receive information about scheduling electronic fingerprinting and paying local and state fees.
site_details: Go to www.in.gov/isp, Click on "Firearms Licensing" in far left column. -- Choose "Apply for a New License to Carry" from options in the drop list, and then click the link to fill out the online application.  -- Print the confirmation page or write down application number for your records. -- Schedule and complete appointment for electronic fingerprinting through MorphoTrust (see online application for details). -- Bring application number (from online confirmation page) to your local police department for approval and to pay local licensing fee. -- The application will be electronically transferred to Indiana State Police for final review. -- If approved, the application will be sent to you via mail. If denied, you will receive notification by mail, along with information about the appeals process.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Age 18 or older (age 23 or older, if adjudicated as a delinquent child for an act   that would be felony if committed by an adult) -- Never convicted of a felony -- Never arrested for any felony that involved the use of violence

service_description: Offers a year-long prevention program for individuals at risk for type 2 diabetes. Enrolled participants are provided with tools to form healthy lifestyle habits related to nutrition, physical activity, and more. Weekly sessions are led by a trained lifestyle coach and include opportunities to interact with other program participants. Services are available through a fully virtual platform called INspire Health or via in-person and/or online delivery through participating provider locations.

agency_desc: Largest nonprofit, full service credit counseling organization in the nation. MMI provides professional financial guidance, credit counseling, community-wide educational programs, debt management assistance, bankruptcy counseling and education services, and housing counseling assistance to customers via phone, internet, and in-person sessions at local offices throughout the country. MMI is a HUD-approved housing counseling agency and also a member of the National Foundation for Credit Counseling (NFCC) and the Association of Independent Consumer Credit Counseling Agencies (AICCCA).
service_description: Provides financial guidance, credit counseling, debt management assistance, bankruptcy counseling and education, and foreclosure prevention counseling to people in need, via phone-based and online services.

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection.

(Note: Everyone is entitled to receive one free credit report from each of the three credit reporting agencies per year.)
site_details: Call or visit website to order a report from this agency. (To order a free report from any of the three agencies, visit the website or call for information) -- To dispute information in a credit report, visit the credit agency's website to fill out a   dispute form or call the number listed in the credit report to receive a dispute form in the mail.
site_eligibility: Limit one free report per agency per year

agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related to food, agriculture, natural resources, rural development, and nutrition.
service_description: Accepts complaints of discrimination by the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP/food stamps) and the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) program. Discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, religion, or political beliefs is specifically prohibited within these programs. Federal civil rights laws also make it illegal to discriminate against someone who has filed a complaint.
site_details: Complaints must be submitted in writing. -- Call to request an application or obtain one online. -- Include personal contact information and as much detail as possible about the time and location of the alleged discrimination, the nature of the incident, the alleged basis of discrimination, and names and contact information of others with knowledge of the incident.
site_eligibility: Applicants or recipients of SNAP (food stamps) or WIC -- Believe they have experienced discrimination in the program on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, religion, political beliefs, or because they filed a complaint -- No later than 180 days from the date of the alleged discrimination or when the   complainant became aware of the alleged discrimination

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that uses the 12 Steps and 12 Traditions as the principles and guides to develop honest and healthy relationships with others.
service_description: Offers support groups for persons with a desire to develop healthy, loving relationships. Listings of in-person, online, and phone meetings are available online or by phone.
site_details: Call or visit website to find local meeting times and places as well as online/phone meetings. Callers may need to leave a message for a return call.
site_eligibility: Persons who desire healthy and loving relationships -- Meetings labeled as "Open" are for anyone interested in attending. Meetings labeled as "CLOSED"   are for those who identify as codependents (or as members of the Fellowship). -- There may be other qualifiers such as gay, women, men.  -- Meetings are autonomous and may set other limits though no meeting is supposed to bar an individual seeking a meeting that has no other choice in the vicinity.

agency_desc: A nonprofit helping homeowners navigate budget problems and avoid mortgage foreclosure.
service_description: Offers confidential housing counseling by phone and online to help homeowners avoid mortgage foreclosure and mortgage modification scams. Certified, HUD-approved (U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development) counselors review individual financial needs, develop a plan to address budget issues, and may act as a liaison between the homeowner and lender to discuss available options to prevent foreclosure. Refers to local nonprofit resources for additional assistance and support. This agency does not offer financial or legal assistance, nor can it force a mortgage company to eliminate debt or forgive payments.
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Homeowners -- Having financial problems that could result in mortgage foreclosure

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.
site_name: NATIONAL IMMIGRANT JUSTICE CENTER - ASYLUM SEEKERS HOTLINE
service_description: Provides free legal representation to asylum seekers fleeing persecution in their homelands.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; keep calling until you get through; Appointments are first come, first serve. If you did not get an appointment, you will have to call back the next week.  (When making appointment if an interpreter is needed please notify staff; must supply your own if in a language other than Spanish or English)
site_schedule: Asylum Hotline: Thurs 10am; first come, first serve
site_eligibility: Income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.
site_name: NATIONAL IMMIGRANT JUSTICE CENTER - LGBTQ HOTLINE
service_description: Provides consultation, direct legal services, and representation for immigration services, family based petitions, unaccompanied immigrant children, naturalization, citizenship, LGBT immigrants, and refugee adjustment. Services include applications for cases involving Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), asylum, Green Cards, or work permits, U visa for victims of crimes, and T visa for victims of trafficking. Assists people in deportation proceedings or renewals, consular proceedings and waivers, Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) petitions, and with special immigrant juvenile status, and the Nicaraguan Adjustment/Central American Relief Act (NACARA).
site_details: Call the hotline during designated hours to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.

service_description: Provides legal orientation and representation to immigrant adults and children who are held by the Department of Homeland Security Immigration and Customs Enforcement in immigration detention. Experienced  staff attorneys and paralegals also visit immigration detention centers to conduct presentations explaining to detained immigrants what their rights are under U.S. immigration law. During these visits, detained individuals may meet one-on-one with staff members and volunteers and may obtain legal representation for their immigration case.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.

agency_desc: A federal department that maintains and manages America's national parks.
service_description: Offers annual passes that cover entrance fees and standard amenity fees at national parks, national wildlife refuges, and national forests and grasslands. Each pass covers a driver and three passengers in a personal vehicle (or up to four adults, at sites that charge per person). Discounted lifetime passes are available for seniors, and free passes are available for persons with permanent disabilities.
site_details: Annual Pass: Walk in to a federal recreation site, call ASK-USGS, or order online. -- Senior and Access Passes: Walk in to a federal recreation site or download an  application from the website and send it, along with copies of required documentation and payment, to the USGS mailing address.
site_schedule: Ask USGS Phone Line: Mon-Fri 10am-6pm -- Federal Recreation Sites: Vary by site
site_eligibility: For Annual Pass: Open -- For Senior Lifetime Pass: United States citizens or permanent residents -- Age 62 and over -- For Access Pass: United States citizens or permanent residents -- With permanent disabilities

agency_desc: A government organization that aiming to improve the lives of our nations service members, families and veterans by advancing excellence in psychological health and traumatic brain injury.
service_description: Provides service members, veterans, military families, and advocates with information about psychological health and traumatic brain injury, and offers referrals to local treatment options. Information and referral services are provided through a 24-hour call center, online chat, and email.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, email, or use the website's live chat feature to speak confidentially with a trained health consultant.
site_eligibility: Military service members, veterans, deployed civilians, and concerned family, friends, and professionals

agency_desc: Offers a free support service call center sponsored by the Department of Defense to provide assistance and resources to service members and their families on many different issues.
service_description: Provides online and phone-based assistance to service members and their families on many issues such as money management, spouse employment, parenting and child care, relocation and deployment assistance, reunion, elder care, and non-medical counseling for short-term and solution-focused issues (including work and home relationships, adjusting after a deployment, marital issues, parenting, stress, grief, and loss).
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit website for information, assistance, or referrals. Persons seeking face-to-face counseling will be referred to local providers after an initial phone assessment.
site_eligibility: US military members (active-duty, guard, and reserve) and their immediate family

agency_desc: A commercial telephone service provider that offers a discounted telephone and internet services to those in need.
service_description: Provides discounted landline phone services to low income households in the AT&T service area. Lifeline provides a monthly discount on basic local telephone service, as well as discounted line connection and a waiver of deposit for new, local-service customers.
site_details: Download application from website or call to have one sent by mail. -- Mail or fax in completed application along with copies of income documentation or assistance   program enrollment.
site_eligibility: Living within the AT&T service area (selected areas in Indiana) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Level -OR- Receiving at least one of the following: Food Stamps (SNAP) -- Medicaid -- Supplemental Security Income (SSI) -- Federal Public Housing/Section 8 -- Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) -- Household not receiving Lifeline assistance for any other phone line, including cell service (Exceptions for multiple families living in a single household.) -- Service will be for applicant's primary residence and billed in applicant's name

agency_desc: A commercial telephone service provider that offers a discounted telephone and internet services to those in need.
service_description: Provides discounted home internet services to low income households in the AT&T service area. Access provides a monthly discount on basic home internet, as well as free activation and a waiver of deposit for new, local-service customers. All installation and equipment fees will be waived. Service is provided up to one year with no commitment; services may be canceled any time.
site_details: Visit the website to apply, download the forms or call to have one sent by mail. -- Email or mail completed application along with copies of verified SNAP benefit.
site_eligibility: Living within the AT&T service area -- Limited income (based on the website) -- At least one member of the household receiving Food stamps (SNAP) -- Participate in National School Lunch -OR- Head start programs -- Service will be for applicant's primary residence (does not have to be in account holder's name) -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Offering two months free service to new customers who order by April 30, 2020 -- Expanding eligibility based on income -- Waving all home internet data overage fees

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists with the identification, treatment, and cure of rare disorders through programs of education, advocacy, research, and service.
service_description: Administers patient-assistance programs for persons diagnosed with rare "orphan" diseases: Medication Assistance programs help with the cost of specific medications. -- Disease Specific Assistance programs help with out-of-pocket expenses for insurance premiums, deductibles, and co-payments.-- Travel and Lodging Assistance for "study participants" helps with costs incurred when traveling to participate in certain clinical trials.
site_details: Call for a phone assessment or visit the website for a list eligible medications or disease diagnoses.
site_eligibility: Varies by program

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
agency_desc: Oversees federal governmental programs for health and human services.
site_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES-  OF THE INSPECTOR GENERAL
service_description: Accepts and investigates reports of suspected fraud, waste, errors, or abuse in federal health and human service programs, including Medicare,  Medicaid, food stamps/SNAP, HUD-funded housing, and state health insurance. Reports may be made by phone, mail, fax, or online, and may be made anonymously.
site_details: Call, mail, or fax report of suspected fraud or use the online form.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
agency_desc: Oversees federal governmental programs for health and human services.
site_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES - CIVIL RIGHTS
service_description: Accepts and investigates complaints of discrimination based on race, color, national origin, disability, age, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity), or religion by a health care or human services provider or by a state or local government health or human services agency. Examples of agencies covered by this department include hospitals, health clinics, doctors' offices, pharmacies, nursing homes, day-care centers, alcohol and drug treatment centers, adoption agencies, and mental health agencies, as well as local and state Medicaid, Medicare, and TANF agencies.
site_details: Submit complaint online or to the regional office by mail, fax, or e-mail, (preferably using the "Civil Rights Discrimination Complaint Form Package," available online) -- Include the name of the health care or social service provider involved and describe the acts or omissions believed to be discriminatory.
site_eligibility: Persons with a complaint of discrimination (based on race, color, national origin, disability, age, gender [including sex stereotyping and gender identity], or religion) by a health care   provider or state or local government health or human services agency -- No later than 180 days from the date the complainant became aware of the alleged discrimination -- Note: Individuals may file a complaint for themselves or on someone else's behalf.

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
agency_desc: Oversees federal governmental programs for health and human services.
site_name: HIV INFO - DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
service_description: Provides the latest federally approved information on HIV/AIDS clinical research, treatment, and prevention and medical practice guidelines for people living with HIV/AIDS, their families and friends, health care providers, and researchers. Information is available by phone or online.
site_details: Call, email, or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
agency_desc: Oversees federal governmental programs for health and human services.
service_name: SENIOR INFORMATION AND REFERRAL FOR OLDER ADULTS
service_description: Connects older adults, families, and caregivers to resources in their local area. Callers and website visitors may search for resources by city/town, zip code, and by topic.
site_details: Call, email, or use the online locator.
site_eligibility: Open -- Older Adults

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission to strengthen struggling famililes so they can stay together.
service_description: Offers a 24-hour crisis, resource, and referral line for young people and parents. Trained counselors provide problem-solving help and referrals for local resources. Referrals are given for issues such as; depression, anger management, suicide, physical, sexual, or emotional abuse, school issues, relationship problems, and bullying, parenting challenges and runaway issues.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website to speak with a counselor.
site_eligibility: Youth up to age 23 -OR- parents of youth

agency_desc: A national provider of wireless voice, messaging, and data services. Lifeline discounted service is available through subsidiary Assurance Wireless.
service_description: Offers a free cell phone and 350 minutes of free, nationwide, wireless voice service each month to Indiana households receiving public assistance or within set income guidelines. Minutes do not roll over from month to month. Additional minutes can be purchased. Limit one Lifeline service per household. Promotions may be available to qualify for additional free minutes, texts, and/or data.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application. -- Mail or fax completed application along with any required documentation. -- Customers must make at least one call per month and must reapply each year to continue service.
site_schedule: Automated Application Information: Daily 24 hours -- Customer Care: Daily 8am-9pm
Automated Application Information: Daily 24 hours -- Customer Care: Daily 8am-9pm
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Level -OR-   receiving Medicaid, food stamps, SSI, TANF, Section 8, EAP, or free school lunch -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)

agency_name: SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES ADMINISTRATION
agency_desc: An agency within the United States Department of Health and Human Services that reduces the impact of substance abuse and mental illness in American's communities.
site_name: SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT REFERRAL LINE
service_description: Provides a confidential, 24-hour helpline for persons seeking resources for substance abuse or mental health issues for themselves or a loved one. Referrals to local treatment facilities, support groups, and community programs are provided. A website is also available for persons to locate resources online.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or use website to find local treatment resources.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES ADMINISTRATION
agency_desc: An agency within the United States Department of Health and Human Services that reduces the impact of substance abuse and mental illness in American's communities.
service_description: Provides emotional support, crisis counseling, and resource information to persons emotionally affected by a natural or man-made disaster. Calls and texts are routed to regional crisis centers where trained staff provide 24-hour assistance. Additional information about coping with disaster-related grief and stress is available online, including resources for students, parents, teachers, responders, and health professionals.
site_details: Call the Helpline or text "'TalkWithUs" to 66746. Additional information and resources available online.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES ADMINISTRATION
agency_desc: An agency within the United States Department of Health and Human Services that reduces the impact of substance abuse and mental illness in American's communities.
service_description: Connects individuals experiencing a suicidal crisis or seeking help for someone else with trained crisis counselors for emotional support and additional resources via free and confidential web chat.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit the website for assistance; a short survey and agreement to the Terms of Service must be completed to be connected with a counselor.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An independent United States government agency. The FCC was established by the Communications Act of 1934 and is charged with regulating interstate and international communications by radio, television, wire, satellite and cable. The FCC's jurisdiction covers the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and U.S. possessions.
service_description: Accepts complaints concerning television, radio, telephone, and fax communications issues, including: broadcast interference, disability access (closed captioning, relay services), obscene/indecent programming, billing, service, privacy, and unauthorized switching.
site_details: Call or visit the website to file a complaint.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides information about cancer, clinical trials, and smoking cessation.
service_description: Provides information about cancer, cancer treatment, smoking cessation, and cancer clinical trials to the general public and to health professionals. Callers may order free publications, talk to a cancer information specialist, or receive information about quitting smoking. All services are also available via the website, including online chat with a cancer information specialist.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or help quitting smoking.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that promotes improvement in the lives of people with schizophrenia-related illnesses and their families by providing education and support groups.
service_description: Hosts a phone support group for persons with schizophrenia and related disorders.
site_details: Go to sczaction.org to register for support group.
site_eligibility: Individuals with schizophrenia and related disorders -- Family and friends of those diagnosed

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing transportation services to those in need.
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb transportation to persons in need who live within Boone Township of Porter County. Van is wheelchair accessible. Reservations are required and must be made at least 24 hours in advance.
site_details: To Become a Client: Call for a home visit assessment -- To Schedule a Ride: Call to request a ride reservation 24 hours in advance of desired travel
site_eligibility: In need of transportation due to age, disability, or income -- Traveling within 20 miles of Boone Township

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides scholarships and interest free loans to eligible high school students.
service_description: Provides scholarships and interest free loans annually to 10-12 students. Interest-free loans of $750 per year for each year the student is in school to a maximum of $3000. Loans are to be paid back after graduation. Gives 1-2 grants of $750 for the first year of college.
site_details: Graduating seniors can pick up an application from their school guidance counselor or print one off of the website.
site_eligibility: Graduating senior from high school

agency_desc: A federal government agency that provides an online to government information and services.
service_description: Informs citizens of government benefits they may be eligible for and provides information on how to apply for assistance. Live information specialists are available.
site_details: Visit the website or call for information.
site_schedule: Website: Daily 24 hours -- National Call Center: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A private organization that provides non-medical, in-home services with a goal to increase the quality of life of every individual they serve.
service_description: Provides in-home, nonmedical, personal care for persons age 65 and older due. Prepares an individualized care plan that may provide assistance with daily living activities, light housekeeping, errand running, companionship, bill paying, and transportation.
taxonomy_name: Attendant Services for People With Disabilities
nameLevel3: Attendant Services for People With Disabilities
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for a free in-home assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 65 or older -- Unable to complete daily living activities (based on assessment) -- Additional admission and insurance criteria may apply

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to promote animal welfare through community awareness, education, low cost spay/neuter clinics and responsible pet adoptions.
service_description: Provides low cost neuter and spay services such as vaccinations, prevention and micro-chipping to pets.
site_details: Call, email or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Participating in a government assistance program

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Assists with health and wellness questions, and help locating health care providers. Offers educational wellness programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A division of American Electric Power that provides electricity and related services to 16 Indiana counties and 5 Michigan counties.
service_description: Provides a free home weatherization assessment and energy-saving home improvements to qualified homeowners and renters served by Indiana Michigan Power. Trained energy experts visit the home to evaluate energy loss and, if indicated, pay for up to 100% of home upgrades, up to $3000. These include, but not limited to, attic or sidewall insulation, caulking, weather-stripping, duct sealing or repair, and install for energy efficient shower heads and new LED light bulbs. Currently, this program is being done virtually until I&M COVID Restrictions are lifted.
site_details: Call the Weatherization Line to schedule a Virtual Energy Audit appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Summer Assistance: July 1-Aug 31 -- Winter Assistance: Nov 1-May 15
site_eligibility: Indiana Michigan Power customer -- Household income is at or below 200% of Federal Poverty Level -- HOME is a single family dwelling or duplex (owner-occupied or rented) -- HOME is electrically heated -- If renting, landlord must authorize the assessment by completing an additional form -- If renting, electric bill must be in renter's name -- HOME has not had a utility-sponsored assessment within the last 3 years

agency_name: INDIANA ASSOCIATION OF WORKERS FOR THE BLIND
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists all persons who have significant visual impairment in coming together for the purpose of discussing issues of common significance and to provide ongoing social activities for members.
site_name: INDIANA ASSOCIATION OF WORKERS FOR THE BLIND
service_name: SOCIAL EVENTS FOR THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED
service_description: Provides a monthly meeting with information on relevant  topics for persons who are visually impaired, which includes lunch. Offers other social activities, assistance in getting social service assistance, and general support. Transportation to the events is provided. Location of the meeting changes each month.
site_details: Call for meeting schedule, transportation, and membership information.
site_eligibility: Persons with visual impairments -OR- who are legally blind

agency_desc: A commercial agency that provides kidney health education.
service_description: Provides health education services free of charge. Class subject cover kidney health including kidney function, causes and prevention of chronic kidney disease (CKD), and treatment options for late stage CKD.
site_details: Visit the website to register for classes. www.kidneysmart.org
site_schedule: Class times vary, visit website to register.
site_eligibility: People at risk for kidney disease

agency_desc: Nonprofit organization that makes urgent repairs and accessibility improvements for low-income homeowners in Delaware County.
service_description: Volunteers make carpentry repairs and professionals are hired to make plumbing, electrical, and furnace repairs.
site_details: Visit the website to submit an application. www.homesaversmuncie.org
site_eligibility: Must have owned and resided in home for a minimum of two years -- Low-income -- Must be up-to-date on property taxes and sewage bill

agency_desc: An agency that provides caregiver coaching, support, and financial assistance.
service_description: Provides in-home caregiver training, support and financial assistance in the form of a daily stipend.
site_details: Call for information and eligibility.
site_eligibility: Must qualify for an Indiana Medicaid Waiver -- Must have a caregiver

agency_desc: A national nonprofit organization providing a one time referral to participating dentists for free dental services.
service_description: Provides a one time referral to participating dentists in area of applicant that provides free dental services. Emergency dental services and cosmetic dental treatments are not provided.
site_details: Call or visit website for information or to download an application. Applications can be downloaded, emailed, faxed, or sent in USPS mail.
site_eligibility: Age 65 or older -OR- Have a permanent disability -OR- Need medically necessary dental care -- Lack adequate income to pay for dental care -- Not living in Clark, Floyd, Harrison, Jackson, Jefferson, Lawrence, Madison, Miami, Monroe, Morgan, Pike, Ripley, Scott, Vanderburgh, Warrick or Wayne County; exceptions given for those with documentation from a physician stating dental condition prevents receiving essential medical treatment -OR- veterans who meets all other qualifications

agency_desc: Patient Advocate Foundation is a liaison between patient and insurer, employer and/or creditors to resolve insurance, job retention and/or debt crisis matters relative to their diagnosis, through case managers, doctors and attorneys. Patient Advocate Foundation uses mediation to ensure access to care, maintenance of employment, and preservation of financial stability.
service_description: Provides direct payment for co-pays, co-insurance, and deductibles for patients who need financial assistance.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply. www.copays.org/patients
site_eligibility: 300-400% below the federal poverty guideline - currently insured with coverage for the medication(s) for which they seek financial assistance

service_description: Provides a variety of support groups, workshops, and trainings to address ongoing life struggles for adult survivors of abuse and sexual trauma. agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that delivers hot meals to home-bound persons living in Zionsville.
service_description: Delivers hot lunches each weekday to homebound persons living in Zionsville. A physician's diet prescription is required.
site_details: Call to request an application. -- Contact physician to request diet prescription be sent.
site_eligibility: Living within 3-mile radius -- Home-bound persons unable to prepare meals -- With a physician's diet prescription

agency_desc: A nationwide partnership between the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America (PhRMA), health care providers, pharmacists, and patient advocacy organizations seeking to provide patients with a single point of access to public and private prescription assistance programs.
service_description: Provides a free-to-use search engine that helps patients in need find prescription medication discount programs available through drug manufacturers, pharmacies, and other related service providers. Assistance available online or via automated helpline.
site_details: Visit the website or call the automated helpline to search for programs by drug name.
site_eligibility: Uninsured or under-insured with little to no prescription medication coverage -- With demonstrated financial need (typically at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level) -- Additional eligibility requirements may apply depending on specific drug manufacturer program and/or medication
